arch_conf.name: Description
arch_conf.value: RISC-V is an instruction set architecture (ISA) based on the RISC type and its hardware is free. This architecture was created in 2010 at the University of California, Berkeley.

instructions.name: div
ecall
fclass.d
instructions.definition:
let a = capi_float2bin(rs1);
rd=capi_check_ieee(parseInt(a[0]), parseInt(a.slice(1,12), 2), parseInt(a.slice(13), 2));

instructions.name: fclass.s
instructions.definition:
let a = capi_float2bin(rs1);
rd=capi_check_ieee(parseInt(a[0]), parseInt(a.slice(1,9), 2), parseInt(a.slice(10), 2));

instructions.name: fdiv.d
fdiv.s
fld
fsd
fsgnjx.d
instructions.definition:
let a = rs1<0; let b = rs2<0;
rd = (a^b) ? -Math.abs(rs1) : Math.abs(rs1);

instructions.name: fsgnjx.s
instructions.definition:
let a = rs1<0; let b = rs2<0;
rd = (a^b) ? -Math.abs(rs1) : Math.abs(rs1);

instructions.name: fsqrt.d
fsqrt.s
fsw
instructions.definition:
var val1 = capi_float322uint(rs1);
 capi_mem_write(rs2+inm, val1, 'w', rs1_name);

instructions.name: jal
lbu
lhu
lw
instructions.definition:
var addr = capi_int2uint(rs1)+inm;
 rd = capi_mem_read(addr, 'w', rd_name);

pseudoinstructions.name: bltz
pseudoinstructions.help: Conditional branch if Rsrc1 is less than zero.

pseudoinstructions.name: la
li
